data.title: Knight Jumps
data.statement: Given [[8]] lines of [[8]] letters with the chess knight marked by [[N]], find the squares that the Knight can jump to, sorted by <<lexicographical order>>.

data.constraints: There will always be exactly one k[[N]]ight on the board.
data.inputDescription:
<<{{8}} Lines:>> First {{8}} characters: {{.}} (Empty) or {{N}} (Knight), then an Integer corresponding to the Rank ({{8}} down to {{1}}).
<<1 Line:>> {{8}} letters: {{abcdefgh}}, corresponding to the File.
data.outputDescription: <<Up to {{8}} lines:>> Squares that the knight can jump to, in notation, sorted. Any square from {{a1}} to {{h8}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given 8 lines of 8 letters with the chess knight marked by N, find the squares that the Knight can jump to, sorted by lexicographical order.
Input
8 Lines: First 8 characters: . (Empty) or N (Knight), then an Integer corresponding to the Rank (8 down to 1).
1 Line: 8 letters: abcdefgh, corresponding to the File.
Output
Up to 8 lines: Squares that the knight can jump to, in notation, sorted. Any square from a1 to h8.
Constraints
There will always be exactly one kNight on the board.
Example
Input
........8
........7
........6
........5
........4
..N.....3
........2
........1
abcdefgh
Output
a2
a4
b1
b5
d1
d5
e2
e4
